alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Hughes; Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 10 at 5:16AM CDT until June 10 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Southern Lincoln County in central Oklahoma... Eastern Oklahoma County in central Oklahoma... Northeastern Cleveland County in central Oklahoma... Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... Northern Hughes County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 600 AM CDT. * At 516 AM CDT, the leading edge of winds from a line of severe thunderstorms was located along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Welty to 6 miles west of Sparks to near Edmond, moving south at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Eastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, Seminole, Tecumseh, Holdenville, Chandler, Choctaw, Harrah, Slaughterville, McLoud, Spencer, Wewoka, Jones, Nicoma Park, Prague and Pink. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Hughes; Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Seminole
